My name is Patrick Rivera and I'm a software engineer, writer, and investor. I currently work at [Mirror](https://mirror.xyz), a crypto protocol building tools for web3 creators and communities. It's like if Kickstarter, Patreon, and Substack had a crypto baby. That's Mirror.

Over the past few months, we've shipped:

* [A decentralized publishing protocol](https://dev.mirror.xyz/J1RD6UQQbdmpCoXvWnuGIfe7WmrbVRdff5EqegO1RjI)
* [Tokenized crowdfunding](https://dev.mirror.xyz/llJ_AboiDJwB_ZAFz-CXU7fL2p8v5Wz6MjfluLafewQ)
* [NFT auctions](https://dev.mirror.xyz/_OstP6dwYsX-0YsIaGDw-W4fs3VzESC_QpxrhiyM_Bg)
* [NFT editions](https://dev.mirror.xyz/AOoIsKPfZvf8LACKWp7gj_mg1ICCDOfPnVBOsDQoXo8)
* [Dutch auctions](https://brightmoments.mirror.xyz/drops/0x45117047059f6AE25306c662144884E7F4df877f)
* [On-chain revenue splits](https://dev.mirror.xyz/V_7Jp1hy_g8bz-J1B4Wb5KYSmj5Lt4W7q7cw0noxJsU)
* [A tokenized referral program](https://mirror.xyz/race)

We've worked with [artists](https://brightmoments.mirror.xyz/drops/0x45117047059f6AE25306c662144884E7F4df877f), [filmmakers](https://ethereumfilm.mirror.xyz/3SV8gLXHIW8Ot45h3RL7aOgDINxN2hjLfFVOvyatB2A), [writers](writers.mirror.xyz/0AFENlMKv9amUC1OJIZY26udpISw_raXkoEcvelPvzg), [open source projects](https://stateful.mirror.xyz/rsUhYxXARr7j2iDjqJeelY7nc6CN_Y-MilVDP1S5voA), [musicians](https://songcamp.mirror.xyz/mkb-m9GWUCLByETAvCigJ0JIpz4XH8bwNDBtUJBPeFc), [e-sports teams](https://blvkhvnd.mirror.xyz/crowdfunds/0x320d83769Eb64096Ea74B686Eb586E197997f930), [grant giving DAOs](https://club.mirror.xyz/dnN3Dwe-iD6jBpzkase4YLHTxYtnuFnmUbSoOfPEkjI), [party DAOs](https://d.mirror.xyz/FLqkPA3iN4x-p97UhfhWwaCx8rBmVo-1yttY20oaob4), and more.

Previously, I was a growth engineer at [Instacart](https://instacart.com) and a lead growth engineer at a DeFi startup called [Dharma](https://dharma.io).

In my free time, I write about the intersection of crypto, creators, and communities.

Here are some of my most popular posts:

* [A Presentation on Crypto Fundamentals and NFTs](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1sUpk0gbvRQelH0MUIOqjNeGe8nwRH4mhrhDHmI6qh4M/edit?usp=sharing)
* [Come for the Creator, Stay for the Economy](https://p.mirror.xyz/1EpvJwUpx_KlRcHOKLNqADEkwHL_Z1ZYKobF2uLwgBg)
* [Thoughts on DAO Tooling](https://p.mirror.xyz/VlaQ_fH2NNXh0MNyhj4CI13wX8zwJ6boctVpagApPLc)
* [Community DAOs](https://p.mirror.xyz/cVN3KOss0uqpZwxHQKtC4Syvn1RfXaxofFKHJuKLWS4)
* [Designing Internet-Native Economies: A Guide to Crypto Tokens](https://future.a16z.com/a-taxonomy-of-tokens-distinctions-with-a-difference/) (A16Z Future)
* [How Crypto Projects Like Loot are Rewriting the Playbook for Building Communities](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E5LOoHBt85Y) (Means of Creation podcast)
* [The Next Crypto Cycle - Web3, DAOs, and NFTs](https://thedeepend.substack.com/p/the-next-crypto-cycle-web-30-daos) (The Deep End podcast by On Deck)
* [Lifecycle of Web3 Communities](https://www.othersidepod.xyz/episode/18) (On the Other Side podcast by Chase Chapman with accompanying slides [here](https://www.othersidepod.xyz/episode/18))
* [Tips for Creators Getting Into Crypto](https://p.mirror.xyz/WQQywdjjfnksMRPMaNKBMxPBqfE5k8nL6pCLe1roGyw)
* [Crypto-native Newsletter Businesses](https://p.mirror.xyz/CQnk9PLrBAUskCTCHiA5fA9SBDFZGEfCitVH343FWkY)
* [The Emerging Internet Renaissance](https://pwa.mirror.xyz/BoEyMiW_B2DoUZlFNKdfXRn59goHfrsPwvdM8KiLhb4) (an interview done by a friend)
* [Internet Renaissance Vibez](https://p.mirror.xyz/pl07RMWdJZktHUAn8hZ02YlO35-Ju49orPrhaRnn4Vo)

I'm also a member of a few DAOs like [Fingerprints](https://twitter.com/FingerprintsDAO), [Friends With Benefits](https://twitter.com/FWBtweets), [Seed Club](https://twitter.com/seedclubhq), [Bright Moments](https://twitter.com/brtmoments), [Squiggle DAO](https://twitter.com/squiggleDAO), [Cabin DAO](https://twitter.com/creatorcabins), and [Society DAO](https://twitter.com/CryptoSocietyS1).

These DAOs are online communities that launch web3 projects, collect rare NFTs, deploy custom smart contracts, host virtual events, and more.

I think DAOs like these are going to become some of the most influential online communities over the next decade as they amass billion dollar treasuries / market caps and serve as incubators for the best engineers, artists, and builders in the space. I wrote about this [here](https://p.mirror.xyz/cVN3KOss0uqpZwxHQKtC4Syvn1RfXaxofFKHJuKLWS4).

If you want to get in touch, say hi on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/patrickxrivera) or email me at patrick.x.rivera@gmail.com.

ÈÇ£‰πà‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàËøô‰∫õ‰ª£Â∏ÅËÉΩÂ§üËé∑ÂæóÂ¶ÇÊ≠§È´òÁöÑ‰º∞ÂÄºÂë¢Ôºü ÊàëÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÊòØÔºö

Âè¶Â§ñÔºå‰∏äÈù¢ÊèêÂà∞ÁöÑÁõ∏ÂØπ‰º∞ÂÄºÈ´òÁöÑ‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜÂä†ÂØÜË¥ßÂ∏ÅÔºåÂá†‰πéÈÉΩÊòØÂü∫Á°ÄÂ±Ç‰ª£Â∏ÅÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫Âú®ÂÆÉ‰ª¨‰πã‰∏äÂπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÁúüÊ≠£ÁöÑ‚ÄúÂçèËÆÆ‚ÄùÔºå‰ΩÜËøôÁßçÊÉÖÂÜµ‰ºöÁªßÁª≠ÂêóÔºü

ÊØ´Êó†ÁñëÈóÆÔºåL1 ËÇØÂÆö‰ºöÈùûÂ∏∏ÈáçË¶ÅÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÂÆÉ‰ª¨Êèê‰æõ‰∫ÜÊï∞Â≠óÁªèÊµéÁöÑÂïÜÂìÅÔºàÂå∫ÂùóÁ©∫Èó¥Ôºâ„ÄÇÈóÆÈ¢òÊòØËøôÁßçÂïÜÂìÅÊúâÂ§ö‚ÄúÁ®ÄÁº∫‚ÄùÔºü

ÊàëÁöÑÁúãÊ≥ïÊòØÔºåÂÆÉÁõÆÂâçÂπ∂‰∏çÁ®ÄÁº∫ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫Áé∞Âú®ÊúâÂæàÂ§ö‰∏çÂêåÁöÑ L1 Á´ûÁõ∏Êèê‰æõÂÆÉ„ÄÇÂú®ÊüêÁßçÁ®ãÂ∫¶‰∏äÔºåÈÄöËøáËæÉÂ∞èÁöÑ‰∫§ÊòìË¥πÁî®ÂíåÁªèÊµéÊøÄÂä±ÔºåÂÆÉÂèòÊàê‰∫Ü‚ÄúÊØîÁÉÇÊ∏∏Êàè‚ÄùÔºåÂ∞±ÂÉèÂ§ßÈ∫ªÂú®ÁæéÂõΩÂêàÊ≥ïÂåñÊó∂ÂèëÁîüÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖ‰∏ÄÊ†∑„ÄÇÊàë‰ΩèÂú®ÊúÄÊó©Â∞ÜÂ§ßÈ∫ªÂêàÊ≥ïÂåñÁöÑÂ∑û‰πã‰∏ÄÔºåÊàëËÆ∞ÂæóÂΩìÂÆÉÂèëÁîüÊó∂ÔºåÊØè‰∏™Ë°óÂå∫ÈÉΩÊúâ‰∏çÂêåÁöÑËçØÊàøÔºåÊâÄÊúâËøô‰∫õÈÉΩÊòØÁî±Â§ßÈ∫ªÁà±Â•ΩËÄÖÂºÄÂäûÁöÑÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨ËÆ§‰∏∫ËøôÊòØ‰ªñ‰ª¨ÂèëË¥¢ÁöÑÊú∫‰ºö„ÄÇ

ÁÑ∂ËÄåÔºåËøô‰∫õ‰∫∫ÂæàÂø´Â∞±ÂºÄÂßãÂç∑Ëµ∑Êù•‰∫ÜÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫‰ªñ‰ª¨Ôºà‰ª•ÂèäÁßçÊ§çÂ§ßÈ∫ªÁöÑÂÖ¨Âè∏ÔºâÈÉΩ‰∏çÂæó‰∏ç‰∏çÊñ≠Èôç‰Ωé‰ª∑Ê†º‰ª•Áõ∏‰∫íÁ´û‰∫âÔºå‰ªéËÄåÈôç‰ΩéÂà©Ê∂¶Ôºå‰∫∫‰ª¨Âü∫Êú¨‰∏äÁúãÂà∞‰∫ÜÂ§ßÈ∫ªË°å‰∏öÁöÑ "Ê≤ÉÂ∞îÁéõÂåñ"ÔºåL1/L2 ÁöÑ‰∏ñÁïå‰ºº‰πéÂæàÂèØËÉΩÂ∑Æ‰∏çÂ§ö„ÄÇÔºàÂ∞ΩÁÆ°‰ªéÊäÄÊúØ‰∏äËÆ≤ÂÆÉ‰ªçÁÑ∂ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈùûÂ∏∏ÈáçË¶Å‰∏îÂºï‰∫∫ÂÖ•ËÉúÁöÑ‰∏ªÈ¢òÔºåÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÔºöÊâ©Â±ïËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°àÔºâ

![92beb0cb2651279a0c122b70f244e20.png](https://www.techflow520.com/uploads/2022/06/28/fccbf18a0d7dc08ad542a4e3b6b33370.png)

ÊâÄ‰ª•......ÊàëÂèØËÉΩÊòØÈîôÁöÑÔºå**‰ΩÜÂú®ÊàëÁúãÊù•Ôºå‰∏ã‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁâõÂ∏ÇÊõ¥ÊúâÂèØËÉΩÁî±ÂçèËÆÆÊù•ÂÆö‰πâÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÂèØËÉΩ‰∏éÈìæÊó†ÂÖ≥**„ÄÇËøôÂ∞Ü‰ºöÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πàÊ†∑Â≠êÔºüÊàëËÆ§‰∏∫Êàë‰ª¨Â∑≤ÁªèÂèØ‰ª•‰ªéÂá†‰∏™ÊñπÈù¢ÁúãÂà∞ÂÆÉÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õÁ´ØÂÄ™...

1Ôºâ‰∏Ä‰∫õÂ§ßÂûãÂçèËÆÆÂ∞Ü‰ºöÂá∫Áé∞Âú®ÂæàÂ§öÈìæ‰∏äÔºåÊ≠£Â¶ÇÊàë‰ª¨ÁúãÂà∞ÁöÑAaveÂíåCurveÈÇ£Ê†∑

2) L1Â∞ÜÁñØÁãÇÂú∞Á´û‰∫âÔºå‰ª•Âê∏ÂºïÊúâ‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÂçèËÆÆ„ÄÇ

3ÔºâÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑË∑®Èìæ‰∫íÊìç‰Ωú

4ÔºâÂçèËÆÆÂ∞Ü‰ª•Âè¶‰∏ÄÁßçÊñπÂºèÂª∫Á´ãËá™Â∑±ÁöÑ‚ÄúÈìæ‚Äù

5ÔºâÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÁúãÂà∞ÈÇ£‰∫õÁªßÁª≠ÊúùÁùÄÂêàÊ≥ïÂåñÁöÑ„ÄÅÂÖ∑ÊúâÊúâÊú∫Áé∞ÈáëÊµÅÁöÑ„ÄÅ‰∏ç‰æùËµñÈìæÊúçÂä°ÁöÑÂçèËÆÆÂèëÂ±ïÔºåÂ¶Ç $BIFI„ÄÅ$GMX„ÄÅ$GNS„ÄÅNFT Â∏ÇÂú∫Á≠â

6ÔºâÊàë‰ª¨ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÁúãÂà∞Ôºà‰∏éÈìæÊó†ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÔºâÁ®≥ÂÆöÂ∏ÅÁªßÁª≠Âú®Âä†ÂØÜË¥ßÂ∏Å‰∏≠Ëé∑ÂæóÂ∏ÇÂú∫‰ªΩÈ¢ùÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÂÆÉ‰ª¨‰ºº‰πéÊûÑÊàê‰∫ÜËøÑ‰ªä‰∏∫Ê≠¢ÊúÄÂÖ∑Á≤òÊÄßÁöÑ‚ÄúÁî®‰æã‚ÄùÔºåÂç≥‰ΩøÁâõÂ∏ÇÊÅ¢Â§çÔºå‰πüÂèØËÉΩÂç†ÊçÆÂâç 10 Âêç

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3IUcjGCfzFJUUDKhDe3bw.png?height=731&width=739)

Áªº‰∏äÊâÄËø∞Ôºå**ËÆ§‰∏∫Êú™Êù•‰∏éÈìæÊó†ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÔºåÊòØÊâÄÊúâËøô‰∫õË∑®ÈìæÊ°•ÁÅæÈöæÔºåÂ∞±ÂÉè Harmony ÂèëÁîüÁöÑÈÇ£Ê†∑**„ÄÇÁÑ∂ËÄåÔºå‰ºº‰πéËøô‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢òÂ∞Ü‰ª•ÊüêÁßçÊñπÂºèÂæóÂà∞Ëß£ÂÜ≥ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÂæàÊòéÊòæÔºå‰∏∫‰∫ÜÈÅøÂÖç‰ª§‰∫∫ÊúõËÄåÂç¥Ê≠•ÁöÑ‰∫§ÊòìÊàêÊú¨ÔºåÊâ©Â±ïËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°àÊòØÂøÖË¶ÅÁöÑ„ÄÇ

**Gamefi/NFT/X2E/ÊâãÊú∫Á≠âËæÉÊñ∞ÁöÑÂûÇÁõ¥Ë°å‰∏ö‰ºº‰πé‰πüÂæàÊúâÂèØËÉΩÊàê‰∏∫Âä†ÂØÜË¥ßÂ∏ÅË∂äÊù•Ë∂äÂ§ßÁöÑ‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜÔºåËøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•Âèñ‰ª£ L1 ‰Ωú‰∏∫ËØ•È¢ÜÂüüËµÑÊú¨‰∏ªË¶ÅÂèóÁõäËÄÖÁöÑÂú∞‰Ωç**„ÄÇ

![63f206f99525cb76462b52028fce317.png](https://www.techflow520.com/uploads/2022/06/28/b749263d7e138ec0d662988934b59b90.png)

title: WOW
body: WOW

title: A quick intro to Ethereum
body:
## What is Ethereum?

Ethereum is a technology that's home to digital money, global payments, and applications. It provides:

* Banking for anyone - no frontiers to do payments, borrow money, lend money, etc.
* Censorship resistant - no government or company has control over Ethereum
* Private internet - no need to provide your personal details to use Ethereum Apps
* Peer-to-peer - move money, or make agreements, directly with someone else. No need to go through intermediaries
* Decentralized - anyone can learn, earn, use and contribute to Ethereum. The network is run by independent contributors from all around the world

## Key Concepts

* Ethereum network is powered with it‚Äôs currency **ETH**
* Your funds are stored in **addresses** (public keys) in Ethereum, similarly to a bank account.
* You get access to your funds through the use of **private keys**, think of it as a super secure password, one private key per address.
* You can have **wallets** that store many addresses (‚Äúbank accounts‚Äù) and private keys (‚Äúpasswords‚Äù) so it allows you to approve payments through the wallet.

## What is a Smart Contract?

A "smart contract" is simply a program that runs on the Ethereum blockchain.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/a-jr3_hELrtW4DSMbo1X3.png?height=628&width=1200)

Imagine you have a complex transaction involving significant money. (i.e. a bet on a basketball team). You would need to go to a lawyer to set up an escrow account, pay them, and wait while they do the work and ensure the contract terms are satisfied (i.e. the match is done). Only once your lawyer has done the work to ensure everything is executed correctly  will you get the document/goods/money, etc.

One of the biggest problems with this traditional approach is the need for trusted individuals to follow through with the contract's outcomes. 

Smart contracts digitize agreements by turning the terms of an agreement into computer code that automatically executes when the contract terms are met.

## Examples of Smart Contracts

You can use smart contracts for all sorts of situations ranging from: financial derivatives, insurance premiums, breach contracts, property law, credit enforcement, financial services, legal processes, crowdfunding agreements.

### Real Estate

Suppose you rent an apartment from me. You can do this through the blockchain by paying in [cryptocurrency](https://blockgeeks.com/guides/what-is-cryptocurrency-everything-you-need-to-know-ultimate-guide/). We can 

.

.

.

.

.

### DeFi Applications:

Smart contracts in DeFi are facilitating the exchange of goods, services, data, funds and so on. Users of centralized financial institutions, such as banks and credit unions, rely on intermediaries to execute a transaction. Whereas, DApps are using smart contracts to ensure that each action is genuine, transparent, and free of human error.

### Democracy

There are many voting systems proposal that leverage the blockchain capability to track everone‚Äôs votes. With their secret key/identity, anyone can vote only once as per the smart contract. . There is no need to recount votes, validate late comins or wait for the final outcome, once the voting time is over: there‚Äôs a new winner!

Insiders vouch that it is extremely hard for our voting system to be rigged, but nonetheless, smart contracts would allay all concerns by providing an infinitely more secure system. Ledger-protected votes would need to be decoded and require excessive computing power to access. No one has that much computing power, so it would need God to hack the system!

Secondly, smart contracts could hike low voter turnout. Much of the inertia comes from a fumbling system that includes lining up, showing your identity, and completing forms. With smart contracts, volunteers can transfer voting online and millennials will turn out en masse to vote for their POTUS.

## Future Articles like this:

* Why Ethereum is a good investment?
* How do I buy ETH from Costa Rica?

## References

[https://ethereum.org/en/what-is-ethereum/](https://ethereum.org/en/what-is-ethereum/)

[https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/smart-contracts/#:\~:text=Smart%20contracts%20are%20a%20type,network%20and%20run%20as%20programmed.](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/smart-contracts/#:\~:text=Smart%20contracts%20are%20a%20type,network%20and%20run%20as%20programmed.)

[https://blockgeeks.com/guides/smart-contracts/](https://blockgeeks.com/guides/smart-contracts/)

title: My resume
body:
I am a senior software engineer with more than 6 years of experience in developing and supporting web applications and databases. For the last 2.5 years I have been performing the role of team leader on several projects. I have a good understanding how to work from concept to completion, have a solid background in software architecture and database design, development and maintenance, working side by side with client in order to achieve the best possible solution for particular business needs.

I have a good experience in development service-oriented and multi-layered architecture projects based mostly on Microsoft technologies stack that includes .Net/C#, .Net Core, ASP.NET MVC/Core, Web forms, Web API, SOAP Web Services, MS SQL, ADO.NET, Entity framework, Azure cloud services, NUnit, Docker. On the front-end part I worked with JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS, Knockout JS, React, Webpack.

I have a great knowledge in managing CI/CD pipelines via Jenkins and Octopus, centralized logging systems, monitoring.

I\`m actual organized, communicative and result oriented person, who enjoys working in an agile team. I like to work on self-development and to interest in technologies, I have less experience with.

title: Decentralized Record Label
body:
Phlote (pronounced "float") is a DECENTRALIZED MUSIC LABEL designed to identify talent and owned by a dedicated team of music lovers. We curate music drops and use NFTs to invest in artists.

Early fans break artists every day across social media, but aren‚Äôt compensated for the work they do. These music lovers provide tremendous value to the music ecosystem, but have historically been unable to capture much of it. Currently, music labels are the only parties positioned to profit from artist discovery and use the signal generated by fans to make investment decisions. What's needed are skin-in-the-game incentives that make profiting from music discovery feel more accessible to fans. 

Capital and distribution can now be offered to artists by fans. Decentralized labels contain three components: 

2. Music Fans
3. Decentralized Curation (voting) 
4. Decentralized Marketplace (monetization)

The curation engine is a bottoms up process that aligns the community around specific music to drop. The marketplace is how the label monetizes.  

Once a song is upvoted through our curation protocol, Phlote pays mint fees for the song to be minted as an NFT and provides marketing and promotional support on the drop. WE DO NOT SIGN ARTISTS. Our services are provided in exchange for a share of proceeds from NFT sales.

Our target community members are music lovers such as DJ's, playlist curators, and distribution partners. Artist are able to tap into a community that really cares about the music and receive feedback.

We've identified a growth flywheel that works like this. The curation engine helps us identify artists. We help artists bring their fans. As the fan community grows, many become curators who introduce Phlote to new artists. A growing fan community also heightens the amplification and sales success we deliver and attracts more artists to the platform, resetting the flywheel.

The power of decentralized curation is it‚Äôs ability to reflect the collective intelligence of a community. We foresee a future where most labels and next gen media networks are powered by humans recommendations. We also believe that the most exciting blockchain platforms are 100% user owned. Combining community ownership with community curation unlocks the power of the internet for our business model.

It‚Äôs important for us to operate in a way that‚Äôs open for anyone to contribute to our mission to help artists achieve financial freedom.

It‚Äôs time.

title: Roger Ver denies CoinFLEX CEO's claims he owes firm $47M USDC
body:
Roger Ver, an early Bitcoin investor and Bitcoin Cash proponent, has pushed against claims from crypto investment platform CoinFLEX regarding an alleged $47-million debt.

In a Tuesday tweet, Ver ‚Äî not mentioning CoinFLEX by name ‚Äî [said](https://twitter.com/rogerkver/status/1541822377461415936) he had not ‚Äúdefaulted on a debt to a counter-party,‚Äù and alleged the crypto firm owed him ‚Äúa substantial sum of money.‚Äù The denial followed rumors on social media that the BCH proponent was [involved](https://twitter.com/austerity_sucks/status/1541732885652275202) in the platform halting withdrawals due to ‚Äúa high-networth client who has holdings in many large crypto firms‚Äù not covering their debts.

CoinFLEX CEO Mark Lamb took to Twitter shortly after the statement to claim the company had a written contract with Ver ‚Äúobligating him to personally guarantee any negative equity on his CoinFLEX account and top up margin regularly.‚Äù According to Lamb, CoinFLEX served Ver with a notice of default and was ‚Äúspeaking to him on calls frequently about this situation with the aim of resolving,‚Äù claiming the firm did not owe him anything.

‚ÄúIt is unfortunate that Roger Ver needs to resort to such tactics in order to deflect from his liabilities and responsibilities,‚Äù said the CoinFLEX CEO.

***Related:¬†[Su Zhu‚Äôs cryptic statement as rumors swirl of 3AC liquidations and insolvency](https://cointelegraph.com/news/su-zhu-s-cryptic-statement-as-rumors-swirl-of-3ac-liquidation-and-insolvency)***

Cointelegraph reported on Tuesday that a CoinFLEX account ‚Äî [held](https://coinflex.com/blog/coinflexs-solution-to-resume-withdrawls/) by a ‚Äúhigh-integrity person of significant means‚Äù ‚Äî incurred $47 million in losses after being allowed to reach negative equity without being liquidated. The platform [planned to fix its liquidity shortage](https://cointelegraph.com/news/coinflex-recovery-plan-includes-tokenized-bad-debt-and-more-yields) by issuing a new token, Recovery Value USD (rvUSD), starting June 28, with user withdrawals expected to resume on June 30.

The price of CoinFLEX‚Äôs native token (FLEX) has fallen more than 84% in the last 30 days, dropping from $1.19 to $0.80 following Lamb‚Äôs and [Ver‚Äôs statements on Twitter](https://cointelegraph.com/news/dogecoin-jesus-roger-ver-resurfaces-on-twitter-backs-doge-over-btc).

*Cointelegraph reached out to Roger Ver and Mark Lamb, but did not receive a response at the time of publication. This story may be updated.*

title: Governing Web3: An Introduction to DAOs
body:
## Status Quo

Let‚Äôs take a modern company structure today. We have the C-suite and board of directors at the top making strategic decisions that determine the direction of the company. From there exists layers of middle management responsible for aligning the work of individual contributors to the direction set forth by executive leadership. Then all the way at the bottom of multiple layers of functional management we have individual contributors ‚Äî the people doing all the work.

In effect a small minority make decisions that impact the vast majority of the company. The advantage of this is the speed with which a decision can be made. The key disadvantages come down to three things. Transparency, Execution Agility, and Openness. A lack of transparency with which the decisions from executives are made can lead to decisions being made that are in the best interest of decision makers, not customers or employees. The time it takes to deploy resources (people, funds, technology, etc) through the layers of middle management often results in wasted resources and often-times missing pivotal opportunities in industry. Lacking openness manifests in the form of contribution from employees and customers. Anyone who has interviewed for a job recently, knows just how difficult it can be to even get your foot in the door. From there the privilege to shape the direction of the company is earned over decades of service. At the end of the day, any given company is missing out on tons of available talent. A customer trying to help improve a product through feedback also has many hurdles to clear. They typically have to be very large customers to have direct executive access. Or they have to submit some form that may never be seen or acted upon requesting a new feature that would help them remain loyal to their provider.

Now, lacking transparency, agility, and openness has served a vital purpose in protecting companies. Companies have not had the ability to safely make all their decisions transparent, deploy resources efficiently, and be safely open to any contributor.

If you wanted to design a governance system that is open to the brightest minds around the world, transparent for all to see, agile in bringing innovation to market AND effective; what would you create?

## Enter DAOs

Taking a quick step back ‚Äî we know that Ethereum is a blockchain who‚Äôs most prominent feature is the ability to deploy smart contracts onto its distributed ledger. These smart contracts ‚Äî a vault with programmed logic for accessing its assets ‚Äî are immutable. No one can go back and change the contract once deployed. Its logic must be followed to a ‚ÄòT‚Äô. Imagine for a moment a vending machine stocked with your favorite goodies. In order to access a bag of chips, we must supply multiple inputs in the form of money and a combination code. With the correct inputs, out pops our desired snack.

![Basically a smart contract](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*FlXtHJ7EMwdGHRRC)

Photo by [Kenny Eliason](https://unsplash.com/@neonbrand?utm_source=medium&utm_medium=referral) on [Unsplash](https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=medium&utm_medium=referral)

Today, most smart contracts are being used in service of core financial primitives. Pools of tokens to exchange between, borrowing & lending vaults, and peer-to-peer exchanges of NFTs.

A use for smart contracts that is rapidly gaining popularity is for DAOs (Distributed Autonomous Organizations). DAOs enable communities of individuals to propose new ideas, reach consensus, and deploy resources in services of a common shared vision. All while being open to anyone, transparent in decision making, and agile in execution.

## How DAOs Work

DAOs are composed of three primary building blocks ‚Äî all different smart contracts:

1. Treasury ‚Äî to hold the organization‚Äôs capital
2. Governor ‚Äî to be the consensus & execution engine
3. Token ‚Äî to represent membership & voting rights in the organization

The creation of a DAO, like any smart contract, establishes a vault and rules for interacting with that vault. The logic for interacting with the treasury is written to include governance mechanisms the community can use to manage their pooled capital, typically in the form of proposals made and voted on by organization members.

With all three building blocks in place investors and community members can acquire governance tokens showing they have a vested interest in the success of the DAO. These token holders are then able to draft proposals both ‚Äúon-chain‚Äù and ‚Äúoff-chain.‚Äù On-chain proposals are opened for discussion and voting by other organization members through the execution contract. Once approved, on-chain proposals are automatically executed. In effect, all a proposal is doing is asking permission from the community to move funds in the treasury from one place to another. Could be to pay a salary, make an investment, or even to another DAO.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*JtcWnET1goNODIV1)

Photo by [Marco Oriolesi](https://unsplash.com/@marcooriolesi?utm_source=medium&utm_medium=referral) on [Unsplash](https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=medium&utm_medium=referral)

## Use Cases

The utility of bringing people together towards a common goal, with incentives aligned between themselves and the organization as a whole is limitless. What comes to your mind? How would you utilize a DAO as a governance tool?

Right off the bat, pooling shared capital together and making investments sounds a whole lot like private equity and venture capital. You would be right! This is exactly what [MetaCartel Ventures](https://deepdao.io/organization/ad814279-3f12-428d-820a-be25abb51273/organization_data/finance) is seeking to do for the Web3 community.

What about a group of people all working on an open source platform that produces revenue? RedHat maybe. That is actually how [Uniswap](https://uniswap.org/), [Aave](https://aave.com/), and [Balancer](https://balancer.fi/) operate.

Patreon is another great example. Giving content creators around the web access to fan-sourced capital in exchange for exclusive content, community, and a host of other benefits. Except there is that 5‚Äì12% take rate for using the platform. Why not spin up a DAO yourself so your fans can have a more direct relationship with you and your community?

## Starting Your Own DAOs

Early adopters of DAO methodologies had to endure an agonizing process of writing smart contract code line-by line to create their organizations. [OpenZepplin](https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/governance) provides an excellent framework for creating your own custom DAO contracts.

Fortunately for the less coding inclined of us, there are well established platforms that make creating DAOs as easy as connecting your DeFi wallet of choice to their site and filling out a few parameters! Two of the biggest players in this space are [Aragon](https://aragon.org/) and [DAOhaus](https://daohaus.club/).

These platforms have built in modules for treasuries, voting, governance token creation. All in an intuitive user interface. The downside of using pre-canned DAOs is that you lose fine-grained control of features and functionality.

DAOs as a tool for community governance have seen tremendous momentum, with some [$8.7B sitting in treasuries](https://deepdao.io/organizations) at this time of writing this. What potential do you see in DAOs over the next 3yrs? What pitfalls should open community governance be aware of? Let‚Äôs discuss!

Disclaimer: This article represents my thoughts and opinions only. None of the projects mentioned have influenced or sponsored the creation of this article.

title: Bitcoin miner Mawson to defer all major capital expenditures until market conditions normalize
body:
On Tuesday, Bitcoin ([BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price)) mining company Mawson Infrastructure Group [said](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0001218683/000121390022035365/ea162182ex99-1_mawson.htm) that it was suspending major capital expenditures until market conditions normalize. In addition, the firm is voluntarily reducing its energy use, also called demand response, in light of the market sell-off and high electricity prices due to inflation.¬†

Mawson received its final shipment of Canann A1246 ASIC Bitcoin Miners in June and has no further outstanding payments due for Bitcoin mining rigs. Regarding the company's decision, CEO and founder James Manning said:

> "Despite a volatile market, Mawson is currently continuing to self-mine and is also participating in energy demand response programs where applicable. Additionally, we are fortunate to have no outstanding contracts to purchase ASIC Bitcoin Miners, enabling us to focus on developing our co-location business as an alternate revenue stream while the Bitcoin price is suppressed.

In its latest monthly update, Mawson [disclosed](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220616005559/en/Mawson-Infrastructure-Group-Inc.-Announces-Record-May-2022-Bitcoin-Self-Mining-Hosting-Co-location-and-Operational-Update) that it owned over 40,000 Application-Specific Integrated Circuit (ASIC) Bitcoin mining machines. Combined, the rigs have an estimated hash rate of 3.35 exahash per second, [accounting](https://ycharts.com/charts/fund_chart_creator/fool/?calcs=&securities=&startDate=&endDate=&zoom=1&chartView=&title=&note=&partner=fool_590&format=real&recessions=false&units=false&source=false&liveData=false&quoteLegend=true#/?annotations=&annualizedReturns=false&calcs=&correlations=&dateSelection=range&displayDateRange=false&displayTicker=false&endDate=&format=real&legendOnChart&note=&partner=fool_720&quoteLegend&recessions=false&scaleType=linear&securities=id:I:BNHR,include:true,,&securityGroup=&securitylistName=&securitylistSecurityId=&source=false&splitType=single&startDate=&title=&units=false&useEstimates=false&zoom=1m) for approximately 1.675% of the Bitcoin network's total hash rate. Last year, the firm [generated](https://www.sec.gov/ix?doc=/Archives/edgar/data/0001218683/000121390022013830/f10k2021_mawsoninfra.htm) $19.4 million in total revenue and spent $6.03 million in capital expenditures, or purchasing property and equipment.¬†

***Related: [Compass Mining loses facility after allegedly failing to pay power bill](https://cointelegraph.com/news/compass-mining-loses-facility-after-allegedly-failing-to-pay-power-bill)***

The ongoing cryptocurrency bear market has hit Bitcoin miners hard, with reports that miners [sold their entire May harvest](https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitcoin-miners-sold-their-entire-may-harvest-report). Mining revenues in the sector have since fallen to May 2021 lows. Meanwhile, energy costs have skyrocketed partly due to the fallout of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Due to such a mixture of risk factors, the Bitcoin network's total hash rate has [plunged](https://ycharts.com/charts/fund_chart_creator/fool/?calcs=&securities=&startDate=&endDate=&zoom=1&chartView=&title=&note=&partner=fool_590&format=real&recessions=false&units=false&source=false&liveData=false&quoteLegend=true#/?annotations=&annualizedReturns=false&calcs=&correlations=&dateSelection=range&displayDateRange=false&displayTicker=false&endDate=&format=real&legendOnChart&note=&partner=fool_720&quoteLegend&recessions=false&scaleType=linear&securities=id:I:BNHR,include:true,,&securityGroup=&securitylistName=&securitylistSecurityId=&source=false&splitType=single&startDate=&title=&units=false&useEstimates=false&zoom=1m) nearly 25% in the past two weeks alone.¬†

> "Despite a volatile market, Mawson is currently continuing to self-mine and is also participating in energy demand response programs where applicable. Additionally, we are fortunate to have no outstanding contracts to purchase ASIC Bitcoin Miners, enabling us to focus on developing our co-location business as an alternate revenue stream while the Bitcoin price is suppressed.

title: Key Bitcoin price metrics say BTC bottomed, but traders still fear a drop to $10K
body:
The crypto market is currently going through a period of heightened volatility as global economic conditions continue to worsen amid a backdrop of [rising inflation](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-for-beginners/bitcoin-and-inflation-everything-you-need-to-know) and interest rates.¬†

As the headwinds impacting global financial markets beat down all traces of bullish sentiment, many crypto investors are predicting that Bitcoin ([BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price)) price could drop to as low as $10,000 before a market bottom is found.

*BTC/USDT 1-day chart. Source: TradingView*

While many traders scoffed at the idea of BTC falling below its 2017 all-time high, the recent dip to $17,600 suggests that this bear market could be different from the last one.

Here‚Äôs what several analysts are saying about the possibility of Bitcoin falling to $10,000 in the next few weeks.

## Historic pullbacks point to a low at $10,350

Insight into how BTC may perform in the short-term can be gleaned by looking at its performance during the bear market cycles of 2013 and 2017. In 2013, the maximum drawdown for Bitcoin was 85%, which took place over a period of 407 days. The maximum drawdown in 2017 was 84% and this period lasted for 364 days.

*Historical drawdowns for Bitcoin. Source: Arcane Research*

[According](https://arcane.no/research/bitcoin-is-no-stranger-to-long-and-painful-drawdowns) to a recent report by Arcane Research, the current drawdown has been going on for 229 days and has thus far seen a maximum drawdown of 73%.

Arcane Research said,

> ‚ÄúIf Bitcoin follows the blueprint of these cycles, a bottom should occur sometime in late Q4 2022, at a price as low as $10,350.‚Äù

While there is always a chance that an 85% pullback is a possibility, Arcane Research also noted that ‚ÄúBitcoin is now far more intertwined in the broad financial markets, with the Fed, U.S. elections, crypto regulations and stock market impacting its performance.‚Äù

Further evidence that supports the possibility of a drop to the $10,000 range was touched upon by cryptocurrency research firm Delphi Digital, who posted the following chart noting that ‚ÄúFrom a high timeframe market structure perspective, the next place we have to be looking at is $10K‚Äì$12K.‚Äù

*Brave new coin index for Bitcoin (BLX) 1-month chart. Source: Delphi Digital*

Based on the chart above, the high timeframe market structure support is likely to exist between $9,500 and $13,500.

Delphi Digital said,

> ‚ÄúCoincidentally, this area lines up with the implied low if BTC experiences an 85% drawdown from peak to trough.‚Äù

## Would $10,000 be a good spot to go long?

Not every analyst expects a drop to $10,000. Take for example, Will Clemente of Blockware Solutions. According to Clemente, Bitcoin's current range reflects a good spot for accumulation.

Additional data from Glassnode [shows](https://insights.glassnode.com/the-week-onchain-week-26-2022/) that¬†Bitcoin‚Äôs 200-week moving average, balance price and delta price in its bear market floor model align with the 0.6 Mayer Multiple metric analyzed by Clemente.

*Bitcoin bear market floor models. Source: Glassnode*

Glassnode said,

> ‚ÄúOnly 13 out of 4,360 trading days (0.2%) have ever seen similar circumstances, occurring in just two prior events, Jan 2015 and March 2020. These points are marked in green on the chart.‚Äù

Based on the Delta price metric, which still remains untouched, the potential low for BTC is $15,750.

***Related: [Bitcoin‚Äôs short-term price prospects slightly improved, but most traders are far from optimistic](https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitcoin-s-short-term-price-prospects-slightly-improved-but-most-traders-are-far-from-optimistic)***

*BTC/USD 1-month chart. Source: Twitter*

John Bollinger, the creator of the popular Bollinger Bands trading indicator also [suggested](https://twitter.com/bbands/status/1541443714886684673) that Bitcoin price may have bottomed.

According to Bollinger:

> ‚ÄúPicture perfect double (M-type) top in BTCUSD on the monthly chart complete with confirmation by BandWidth and %b leads to a tag of the lower Bollinger Band. No sign of one yet, but this would be a logical place to put in a bottom.‚Äù

title: Key Bitcoin price metrics say BTC bottomed, but traders still fear a drop to $10K
body:
The crypto market is currently going through a period of heightened volatility as global economic conditions continue to worsen amid a backdrop of [rising inflation](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-for-beginners/bitcoin-and-inflation-everything-you-need-to-know) and interest rates.¬†

As the headwinds impacting global financial markets beat down all traces of bullish sentiment, many crypto investors are predicting that Bitcoin ([BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price)) price could drop to as low as $10,000 before a market bottom is found.

*BTC/USDT 1-day chart. Source: TradingView*

While many traders scoffed at the idea of BTC falling below its 2017 all-time high, the recent dip to $17,600 suggests that this bear market could be different from the last one.

Here‚Äôs what several analysts are saying about the possibility of Bitcoin falling to $10,000 in the next few weeks.

## Historic pullbacks point to a low at $10,350

Insight into how BTC may perform in the short-term can be gleaned by looking at its performance during the bear market cycles of 2013 and 2017. In 2013, the maximum drawdown for Bitcoin was 85%, which took place over a period of 407 days. The maximum drawdown in 2017 was 84% and this period lasted for 364 days.

*Historical drawdowns for Bitcoin. Source: Arcane Research*

[According](https://arcane.no/research/bitcoin-is-no-stranger-to-long-and-painful-drawdowns) to a recent report by Arcane Research, the current drawdown has been going on for 229 days and has thus far seen a maximum drawdown of 73%.

Arcane Research said,

> ‚ÄúIf Bitcoin follows the blueprint of these cycles, a bottom should occur sometime in late Q4 2022, at a price as low as $10,350.‚Äù

While there is always a chance that an 85% pullback is a possibility, Arcane Research also noted that ‚ÄúBitcoin is now far more intertwined in the broad financial markets, with the Fed, U.S. elections, crypto regulations and stock market impacting its performance.‚Äù

Further evidence that supports the possibility of a drop to the $10,000 range was touched upon by cryptocurrency research firm Delphi Digital, who posted the following chart noting that ‚ÄúFrom a high timeframe market structure perspective, the next place we have to be looking at is $10K‚Äì$12K.‚Äù

*Brave new coin index for Bitcoin (BLX) 1-month chart. Source: Delphi Digital*

Based on the chart above, the high timeframe market structure support is likely to exist between $9,500 and $13,500.

Delphi Digital said,

> ‚ÄúCoincidentally, this area lines up with the implied low if BTC experiences an 85% drawdown from peak to trough.‚Äù

## Would $10,000 be a good spot to go long?

Not every analyst expects a drop to $10,000. Take for example, Will Clemente of Blockware Solutions. According to Clemente, Bitcoin's current range reflects a good spot for accumulation.

Additional data from Glassnode [shows](https://insights.glassnode.com/the-week-onchain-week-26-2022/) that¬†Bitcoin‚Äôs 200-week moving average, balance price and delta price in its bear market floor model align with the 0.6 Mayer Multiple metric analyzed by Clemente.

*Bitcoin bear market floor models. Source: Glassnode*

Glassnode said,

> ‚ÄúOnly 13 out of 4,360 trading days (0.2%) have ever seen similar circumstances, occurring in just two prior events, Jan 2015 and March 2020. These points are marked in green on the chart.‚Äù

Based on the Delta price metric, which still remains untouched, the potential low for BTC is $15,750.

***Related: [Bitcoin‚Äôs short-term price prospects slightly improved, but most traders are far from optimistic](https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitcoin-s-short-term-price-prospects-slightly-improved-but-most-traders-are-far-from-optimistic)***

*BTC/USD 1-month chart. Source: Twitter*

John Bollinger, the creator of the popular Bollinger Bands trading indicator also [suggested](https://twitter.com/bbands/status/1541443714886684673) that Bitcoin price may have bottomed.

According to Bollinger:

> ‚ÄúPicture perfect double (M-type) top in BTCUSD on the monthly chart complete with confirmation by BandWidth and %b leads to a tag of the lower Bollinger Band. No sign of one yet, but this would be a logical place to put in a bottom.‚Äù

title: Self-care
body:
Full turbo self-care and let time orchestrates the rest because it's something I can't control (pretty philosophical, lmeow).

> `‚ÄúA healthy diet, strength training, daily walks in the sunshine, 7+ hours of sleep/night, and abstinence from substances is always your first line of defense against anxiety and depression.‚Äù`

It‚Äôs not that I have depression or anxiety, but if you achieve what is written above in a deliberate manner, you certainly will unlock a new level of yourself. It‚Äôs like you have evolve from a Charmander to Chameleon (if you play Pok√©mon, lmeow). 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-6-F6ks5IQJoP1jSZBuxi.gif?height=220&width=220)

I can list you hundred of reasons why you should workout but it‚Äôs not worth. I think it comes from self-care. Self-care comes from many ways I may say. There are things like taking care of your face, eating healthy, a little bit of workout activity, reading books, and doing the things you like. The list goes on but it will have to start from yourself. Some found it at early age and some pretty late. Instead of being late to the party, buckle up but you will have to find a way of yourself to enjoy the process while trying to achieve full self-care. 

I remember I got rinsed so hard, and, yes I go down and get myself sulk in the rain happily because I know for sure it‚Äôs impermanence. I didn‚Äôt resist the flow to hell of myself and I found a way to enjoy it along day and it‚Äôs probably I know what will happen too soon. I couldn‚Äôt sleep for like a month and had to work. I remember waking up everyday like a zombie, lmeow. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cMP3I2e1_um4E1b6ZrFjw.png?height=1333&width=2000)

Since that event, it has changed me and I have speed up the game rapidly fast than the entire species evolution. I was kind of forgetting to bet on myself, and, shhh is okeh for it. Later, I bought a whiteboard and write things down and say I will get it done by Q(X) three months time gap. I know what stopped me and it‚Äôs never stopping me again. 

> `To be honest, everyday I would wake up and apply gel eye mask for about five minutes while making my protein shake. Later, I would go shower and use a decent body lotion and face foam. With sunscreen and moisturizer, I know that will be enough. I do it daily and I never miss it for a single day. In the evening, I would cook myself a high food protein meal (keto meal with no carbs) or I go out drinking. It‚Äôs never a problem for me because I remember one things from the Michael Pollen, and he said ‚ÄúA happy brain is a flexible brain‚Äù. `

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZWzHPx10RP16ySDVp3EzJ.gif?height=498&width=498)

Take care of yourself and try to understand yourself as much as you can because life is a short trip and you gotta make it a meaningful one for yourself while bringing impacts to others as well. 

> `Also, be mindful of the sandcastle you are building because it can get wiped out easily with just big wave. `

I didn‚Äôt stop journaling but I just move in to private board so I can focus on the flow.

Thanks for reading and have a beautiful day as always. Buckle up, lad. Don‚Äôt worry, just twenty-four and not fully twenty-five. ‚ÄúSlow is smooth, smooth is fast‚Äù. 

[https://open.spotify.com/track/2c9OnhCwDVpKZWjOPqKiA8?si=0d90d1b8e7824f3b](https://open.spotify.com/track/2c9OnhCwDVpKZWjOPqKiA8?si=0d90d1b8e7824f3b)

title: That's 'Sir' Crypto Dad: French order knights former CFTC chair Chris Giancarlo
body:
The French government has given former United States Commodity Futures Trading Commission chair Chris Giancarlo, also known as "Crypto Dad," the equivalent of a knighthood.

In a Tuesday tweet from Giancarlo, the former CFTC head [said](https://twitter.com/giancarloMKTS/status/1541752574805786624) France‚Äôs National Order of Merit awarded him a *Chevalier* ‚Äî the equivalent of a knighthood ‚Äî in a ceremony at the French ambassador's residence in Washington D.C. Those attending included current and former CFTC commissioners Rostin Behnam, Brian Quintenz, Christy Goldsmith Romero, Kristin Johnson, Caroline Pham, as well as Hester Peirce of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

The order announced Giancarlo‚Äôs appointment in May. Phillippe Etienne, France's ambassador to the United States, [said](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/j-christopher-giancarlo-named-chevalier-in-national-order-of-merit-by-french-government-301550783.html) the award was due, in part, to the former CFTC chair‚Äôs ‚Äúunderstanding of financial markets and the potentials of crypto finance.‚Äù

‚Äú\[This award\] recognizes the creation of well-regulated crypto trading markets and strengthening of overseas regulatory ties with the help of many fine public servants during my time of government service,‚Äù said Giancarlo at the time.

Giancarlo worked as the chair of the CFTC for five years before leaving in April 2019. During his time with the government agency, he oversaw the launch of regulated Bitcoin ([BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price)) futures and was alleged to have had a ‚Äúdo no harm‚Äù approach to blockchain regulation, earning him the nickname Crypto Dad.

Since leaving the CFTC, Giancarlo has gone on to [join blockchain investment firm CoinFund](https://cointelegraph.com/news/former-cftc-chair-giancarlo-joins-coinfund-as-an-adviser) as a strategic adviser, the board of directors for blockchain startup Digital Asset, and briefly, the board of crypto lending firm BlockFi. He currently works as a senior counsel at the law firm Willkie Farr & Gallagher.

***Related: [Emmanuel Macron on crypto: 'I don't believe in a self-regulated financial sector'](https://cointelegraph.com/news/emmanuel-macron-on-crypto-i-don-t-believe-in-a-self-regulated-financial-sector)***

Other individuals who have previously been knighted by their respective governments have joined the crypto space in various ways. Sir Richard Starkey, also known as Beatles member Ringo Starr, [launched](https://www.ringostarr.com/news/juliens-auctions-presents-ringo-starr-nft-collection-creative-mind-beatle) his own line of nonfungible tokens on June 13. *Star Trek* star William Shatner, who [tokenized a series of trading cards](https://cointelegraph.com/magazine/2020/06/24/william-shatner-nft-wax-blockchain) in 2020, was inducted into the Order of Canada in 2019 ‚Äî though many have said the honor is not equivalent to a knighthood.

title: Love Passion Empathy
body:
**On my mind, today is to talk about how modern applications missed to power us to embrace Love Passion & Empathy.**

**TL;DR**

*We recreate our memories. A new adventure in this virtual environment, so new that it will be painfully familiar to us because this adventure is our memories. Our personal experiences become memories that we often visit. Sometimes we become nostalgic, joyful, even sad and angry until we realize that memories are our salvation, our time machine. We, humans, mirror ourselves in the good memories and remain humility facing the bad ones. At the end of this article, I will end with the words "Memory is nothing more than Passion, Love and Empathy put together." It's 2 o'clock PM every night, there's music playing again and I remember again.*

**Let‚Äôs first try to describe in a small sense what are Love Passion and Empathy meanings by default:**

## Love

*Ohh..The only thing we know about love is that it's –∞ female kind. Nothing more. No one has yet been able to describe her in a book, to explain her. Famous classics like Lermontov most often storytell or kill her, but no one has explained her yet. Maybe because she can't be materialized.  However we cannot remain apathetic to her because she is always unintentional.*

## Passion

*The feeling of wakefulness, we usually associate it with something that did not happen (still unremembered) it's just a flash of the thought. This is something we strive for, which we want and can materialize.*

## Empathy

*It's awareness, has become very modern nowadays, so much that without it we realized we cannot experience love and passion anymore.*

**We can build that with an old and gold web2 infrastructure. No need to web3-alize it. We can link our best memories with the places on a map and invite friends to share our moments**  *\[25 Browning RD, London\]*\**It's 2 o'clock PM* that song is playing again‚Ä¶like in the movie scenes, but our movie scene.

\*\**If you want to participate as a contributor to that idea, become a Collector ü§ç \[ \] ‚ö™*

title: 75% of Marathon's mining fleet still offline two weeks after huge storm
body:
Bitcoin mining company Marathon Digital Holdings has revealed that 75% of its mining capability has been out of commission since a severe storm hit Montana on June 11.¬†

Marathon finally issued a [statement](https://ir.marathondh.com/news-events/press-releases/detail/1287/marathon-digital-holdings-provides-update-on-its-bitcoin) on its website on June 28 explaining that the storm struck across the town of Hardin, Montana on June 11, damaging the power generating facility that supplies Marathon‚Äôs local mining operations. According to the company, ‚Äúinitial electrical tests have found that the majority of the Company‚Äôs miners were not materially damaged by the storm.‚Äù

The company noted that 30,000 devices, or 75% of the company‚Äôs fleet, have been out of action since the storm. Bitcoin blockchain [explorers](https://explorer.btc.com/btc/pool/152) indicate that the miners have been down for two and a half weeks.

> ‚ÄúWith these miners offline, Marathon‚Äôs Bitcoin production is expected to be significantly reduced until repairs to the power generating facility in Montana can be completed or until the miners can be relocated to new facilities.‚Äù

Marathon noted that the facility will remain without power until the damaged power [facility](https://marathondh.com/our-facilities/) from BeoWulf Energy can be repaired.

Marathon‚Äôs CEO Fred Thiel stated that the facility could begin mining again at a reduced capacity as early as the first week of July if certain repairs are made in time.

It has directed its remaining hashpower to contribute to external mining pools while repairs are being made on the damaged facility.

> ‚ÄúMarathon has pointed its remaining active miners, representing approximately 0.6 EH/s, away from the Company‚Äôs mining pool, MaraPool, and towards a third-party mining pool in order to increase the probability of earning Bitcoin.‚Äù

Exahash per second (EH/s) refers to the amount of hashpower a miner contributes to secure the [Bitcoin network](https://images.cointelegraph.com/images/425_aHR0cHM6Ly9zMy5jb2ludGVsZWdyYXBoLmNvbS9zdG9yYWdlL3VwbG9hZHMvdmlldy8wMTEzYzcwNzY5ZTA4OTIxZmYyYTkzYTkxMTc5ZGQ2MS5qcGc=.jpg).

Marathon [contributed](https://ir.marathondh.com/news-events/press-releases/detail/1286/marathon-digital-holdings-announces-bitcoin-production-and) about 3.9 EH/s from 36,830 active miners through May and held 9,941 [BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price) worth about $201.4 million according to [CoinGecko](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/bitcoin).

Mining difficulty is at its lowest level since April according to Bitcoin network tracker [Coinwarz](https://www.coinwarz.com/mining/bitcoin/difficulty-chart).

***Related: [Bitcoin mining revenue mirrors 2021 lows, right before BTC breached $69K](https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitcoin-mining-revenue-mirrors-2021-lows-right-before-btc-breached-69k)***

The company stated that 19,000 miners representing 1.9 EH/s had been installed in Texas-based facilities and were awaiting the energy needed to switch them on.

In light of the functional outages caused by the storm in Hardin, the company said that it is ‚Äúcurrently evaluating the possibility of expediting the move of its miners from Montana to new hosting locations,‚Äù which could include faster deployment to its new Texas facilities in order to prevent this issue in Hardin from happening again.

title: 75% of Marathon's mining fleet still offline two weeks after huge storm
body:
Bitcoin mining company Marathon Digital Holdings has revealed that 75% of its mining capability has been out of commission since a severe storm hit Montana on June 11.¬†

Marathon finally issued a [statement](https://ir.marathondh.com/news-events/press-releases/detail/1287/marathon-digital-holdings-provides-update-on-its-bitcoin) on its website on June 28 explaining that the storm struck across the town of Hardin, Montana on June 11, damaging the power generating facility that supplies Marathon‚Äôs local mining operations. According to the company, ‚Äúinitial electrical tests have found that the majority of the Company‚Äôs miners were not materially damaged by the storm.‚Äù

The company noted that 30,000 devices, or 75% of the company‚Äôs fleet, have been out of action since the storm. Bitcoin blockchain [explorers](https://explorer.btc.com/btc/pool/152) indicate that the miners have been down for two and a half weeks.

> ‚ÄúWith these miners offline, Marathon‚Äôs Bitcoin production is expected to be significantly reduced until repairs to the power generating facility in Montana can be completed or until the miners can be relocated to new facilities.‚Äù

Marathon noted that the facility will remain without power until the damaged power [facility](https://marathondh.com/our-facilities/) from BeoWulf Energy can be repaired.

Marathon‚Äôs CEO Fred Thiel stated that the facility could begin mining again at a reduced capacity as early as the first week of July if certain repairs are made in time.

It has directed its remaining hashpower to contribute to external mining pools while repairs are being made on the damaged facility.

> ‚ÄúMarathon has pointed its remaining active miners, representing approximately 0.6 EH/s, away from the Company‚Äôs mining pool, MaraPool, and towards a third-party mining pool in order to increase the probability of earning Bitcoin.‚Äù

Exahash per second (EH/s) refers to the amount of hashpower a miner contributes to secure the [Bitcoin network](https://images.cointelegraph.com/images/425_aHR0cHM6Ly9zMy5jb2ludGVsZWdyYXBoLmNvbS9zdG9yYWdlL3VwbG9hZHMvdmlldy8wMTEzYzcwNzY5ZTA4OTIxZmYyYTkzYTkxMTc5ZGQ2MS5qcGc=.jpg).

Marathon [contributed](https://ir.marathondh.com/news-events/press-releases/detail/1286/marathon-digital-holdings-announces-bitcoin-production-and) about 3.9 EH/s from 36,830 active miners through May and held 9,941 [BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price) worth about $201.4 million according to [CoinGecko](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/bitcoin).

Mining difficulty is at its lowest level since April according to Bitcoin network tracker [Coinwarz](https://www.coinwarz.com/mining/bitcoin/difficulty-chart).

***Related: [Bitcoin mining revenue mirrors 2021 lows, right before BTC breached $69K](https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitcoin-mining-revenue-mirrors-2021-lows-right-before-btc-breached-69k)***

The company stated that 19,000 miners representing 1.9 EH/s had been installed in Texas-based facilities and were awaiting the energy needed to switch them on.

In light of the functional outages caused by the storm in Hardin, the company said that it is ‚Äúcurrently evaluating the possibility of expediting the move of its miners from Montana to new hosting locations,‚Äù which could include faster deployment to its new Texas facilities in order to prevent this issue in Hardin from happening again.

title: We are launching a simple Play 2 Earn metaverse platform that you can interact with along with some added features. We are not trying to reinvent the wheel but just have our own version. Stick around long enough and we will find out soon enough.
Presenting the Initiator
body:
At Revert we‚Äôre focused on building actionable analytics for liquidity providers in AMM protocols.

We started out by building detailed feeds for existing LP positions. As LPs ourselves, we were in need of a proper way to track the performance of our positions against the originally invested assets, including rewards accrued by participating in the then incipient LP agricultural industry. In turn we built a dashboard to track these positions along with various analytics for the pools themselves. We believe these tools have helped Revert‚Äôs users make better, more informed decisions about their investments.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*O1C0x18MMHegY0A_EvTgqQ.png)

A Uniswap v3 position on Polygon

Today we‚Äôre excited to release the Initiator, our first tool that helps users *initiate* LP positions.

As the AMM landscape has evolved with the release of Uniswap V3, so too have the information needs of most LPs. Opening positions on concentrated liquidity AMMs requires making important decisions about price ranges, which can be greatly aided with historical data and analysis. Fees are a function of volume, time *in range-* and the amount of *liquidity* for a position and the rest of the pool. Where liquidity depends on the amount of capital and the concentration of said capital within a certain price range. All this is to say that running simulations on historical data can help us gain invaluable insights on how the captured fees may change based on the price range that LP selects.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*NTde_E0tYXC8kYxudLsOgg.png)

initiatooooooooooor

When we set out to build the Initiator, we knew that we wanted it do to three things:

1.  Give an accurate measure of the amount of fees we‚Äôd capture with any position based on a specific set of parameters, along with any loss incurred by price divergence
2.  Show volume and liquidity trends for the explored asset pairs
3.  Be blazing fast.

The main feature included the ability to tweak the different parameters a position is composed of, and receive immediate feedback on the effects, as well as being able to quickly switch between different fee tiers for any pair, or switch to a different pair and network altogether.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*VrT3Dtx8xsyHzu6Gy04\_sw.png)

Backtesting before initiating

The end goal for the initiator is to build an an advanced interface for initiating positions across all AMM protocols; backtesting for uniswap v3 positions and pool metrics are just a start. We would love it if you‚Äôd give it a try and jump on [our Discord](https://discord.gg/HXfxKHrRmf) with feedback! <https://revert.finance/#/initiator>

## Diving In

Although our tools are focused at advanced AMM users, it is worth reminding that backtesting can give us an accurate prediction of a position‚Äôs past performance, but it is no guarantee of future results.

Additionally, past price movements for the asset pair and selected range can give you a good idea of the ‚Äúdivergence loss‚Äù that the position would have incurred for that period, but ‚Äî again ‚Äî can not tell us of how the prices will move going forward.

With regards to ‚Äúdivergence loss‚Äù, an important not is that we let you choose between ‚ÄúHODL‚Äù (which refers to the originally invested assets) or either of the token values to benchmark the positions‚Äôs performance against. That is to say, perhaps you care about your PNL in terms of holding ETH instead of both assets; in that case, you can select ‚ÄúETH‚Äù as your reference value. This came about after several user interviews in which we have learned that benchmarking against holding both assets outside of the pool ‚Äî which is the industry standard- only covers a subset of different strategies used by LPs.

With the presentations out of the way, let‚Äôs talk about how the backtester works.

The first thing to thing to mention is that we‚Äôve published the [backtester code](https://github.com/revert-finance/revert-backtester) as a [ClojureScript](https://clojurescript.org/) library under the MIT license.

There are currently at least two techniques that we know of for backtesting Uniswap v3 LP positions:

1.  Technique #1 relies on periodic pool snapshot data, such as that provided by the Uniswap v3's subgraph *poolHourData* entities. This technique is fairly accurate, though the accuracy will be correlated with the proportion of time that a position would have been in range given its selected price ranges. It also has the advantage of being pretty fast. It‚Äôs used by the great[ Uniswap v3 simulator by DeFi labs](https://defi-lab.xyz/uniswapv3simulator), and you can find out more about it [here](https://defi-lab.medium.com/historical-performances-of-uniswap-l3-pools-2de713f7c70f).
2.  Technique #2, used by [ranges.fi](https://ranges.fi/#/) and [described by JNP](https://jnp777.medium.com/a-real-world-framework-for-backtesting-uniswap-v3-strategies-88825abdcd17), uses each individual swap executed within the backtesting period to simulate the proportional fees accrued. The results are of course very accurate, but the technique requires downloading a great amount of swaps for high volume pools, making it a much slower option between the two.

Given that speed requirements for this tool (as mentioned above), we ended up using technique #1 in the Initiator. After implementation, we tested our backtesting accuracy against a set of 1939 open Uniswap v3 positions on *mainnet* that match the following criteria:

*   Created in the last 30 days
*   Only have one deposit
*   Have zero withdrawals
*   Have been open for more than 48 hours
*   Stayed in range over 51% of the time since created

We have found the backtest results to be very accurate when comparing against the actual performance of these positions ‚Äî as shown below with most of our predictions sitting between 90% and 110% of the actual fees captured by each position.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*KJEGDfXzusiYAkMH7wfpdQ.png)

There‚Äôs a few outlier positions with 100% of the time in range that seem to have relatively low accuracy compared to the rest of the set ‚Äî this is, however, a visual effect given the concentration of positions at 100% in range. Below, we can see a histogram of the same accuracy metric: fees predicted / actual fees, but only considering positions that have been in range 100% of the time.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*kSQZTut24ZupE8ql_QqqyQ.png)

We are super excited about finally being able to release our initiator and look forward to learning how LPs make the most out of it. The Initiator itself is initiating, suggestions are greatly appreciated, and we will continue to iterate on the tool based on community feedback.

‡∏ö‡∏ó‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏ô‡∏µ‡πâ‡∏à‡∏∞‡∏™‡∏£‡∏∏‡∏õ‡πÄ‡∏ô‡∏∑‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏û‡∏µ‡πà‡∏≠‡πã‡∏≠‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡∏û‡∏π‡∏î‡∏ñ‡∏∂‡∏á‡πÑ‡∏ß‡πâ‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏ß‡∏µ‡∏î‡∏µ‡πÇ‡∏≠ workshop ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö ‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏ú‡∏π‡πâ‡∏≠‡πà‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏ä‡∏°‡∏ß‡∏µ‡∏î‡∏µ‡πÇ‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏ï‡πá‡∏° ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ñ‡∏î‡∏π‡∏¢‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏´‡∏•‡∏±‡∏á‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ[‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏ô‡∏µ‡πà](https://www.facebook.com/contributiondao/videos/4973445416099491/)
